performance_metrics.name: Provisioning Time (Average)
performance_metrics.description: Average time taken to provision a new infrastructure component (VM, Network, Storage) after applying IaC code. Lower values indicate greater efficiency.

performance_metrics.name: Infrastructure Change Lead Time
performance_metrics.description: Total time from requesting an infrastructure change to its completion. This includes planning, code review, and deployment.

performance_metrics.name: Code Review Turnaround Time
performance_metrics.description: Average time taken for a code review of an IaC template.  Faster reviews reduce deployment cycle times.

performance_metrics.name: Infrastructure Uptime
performance_metrics.description: Percentage of time the infrastructure is available and operational. This is impacted by IaC's automation and error prevention capabilities.

performance_metrics.name: Resource Utilization (CPU, Memory, Storage)
performance_metrics.description: Optimized resource usage reflecting efficient IaC design and deployment. Regular monitoring is crucial.

performance_metrics.name: Rollback Time (Failed Deployment)
performance_metrics.description: Time taken to revert to a previous known-good state after a deployment fails.  Built-in rollback capabilities are essential.

implementation_requirements.name: IaC Tool Selection
implementation_requirements.specifications: Choose a tool (Terraform, Ansible, CloudFormation, Pulumi) based on project needs, team expertise, and cloud provider integration. Support for multiple cloud providers is desirable.
implementation_requirements.description: Selection must align with existing IT strategy and operational needs.

implementation_requirements.name: Version Control
implementation_requirements.specifications: Utilize Git for version control of IaC templates. Branching strategy (e.g., Gitflow) is recommended.
implementation_requirements.description: Ensures code traceability, collaboration, and rollback capabilities.

implementation_requirements.name: Template Management
implementation_requirements.specifications: Establish a standardized template format and naming convention. Utilize modules and reusable components to reduce redundancy. Store templates in a central repository.

implementation_requirements.name: Automation Pipelines
implementation_requirements.specifications: Implement CI/CD pipelines for IaC code, including testing, validation, and deployment stages. Trigger pipelines based on code commits or scheduled intervals.
implementation_requirements.description: Automates the entire infrastructure provisioning process.

implementation_requirements.name: Testing
implementation_requirements.specifications: Implement unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests for IaC templates. Test for security vulnerabilities and compliance requirements.
implementation_requirements.description: Validates the correctness and reliability of the code.

implementation_requirements.name: Security Integration
implementation_requirements.specifications: Integrate security scanning tools into the CI/CD pipeline. Enforce infrastructure-as-code policies based on security best practices. Implement role-based access control (RBAC).

industry_standards: Cloud Provider Specific Standards (e.g., AWS CloudFormation Best Practices)
operational_considerations: Skills Gap: Requires training and expertise in IaC tools and methodologies.
Governance: Establish clear policies and procedures for IaC development and deployment.
Monitoring & Logging: Implement comprehensive monitoring and logging to track IaC performance and identify issues.
Collaboration: Foster collaboration between development, operations, and security teams.
Change Management: Integrate IaC into the existing change management process.
Cost Management: Track IaC resource consumption and optimize costs.
